availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Sarah Kirk. Married to Martha A. Powers Kirk. Father of Ellen Kirk, Mary E. Kirk, Ben F. Kirk, Richard Kirk, and Edward Kirk. Farmer in Franklin County in 1850. Farmer in Franklin County in 1860. Employed Major F. Powers as a laborer in Franklin County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 66B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 323.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Bridgeport, p. 52B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1847-1911), KDLA, Film #994027-994058: Franklin, 1853, p. 3 of 7 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, “Richard Kirk (1825-1869)," Memorial # 53893477, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/53893477/richard-kirk (accessed March 1, 2021).
